content:
Hello there We have read the messsge We try to help

The common message for sending an email with an attachment that is downloaded is too large to process, for example for the mail server service.

Whether this service takes too long for this action.

This is not able to process this and you will receive the above-mentioned message on your screen, just like yours.


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there


To start with, you can indeed check whether the outgoing Smtp configuration is okay.

try to send all data to a backup file first so that your data is safe before you start

After that contact me.

we could run and find a solution together to set the time out server.

Greetings Firefox volunteer.

content: Your settings are correct. What's the antivirus? They often cause timeouts if allowed to scan outgoing mail. If you have an app that isn't Windows Security, it's more likely to cause issues.
creator: sfhowes

Your settings are correct. What's the antivirus? They often cause timeouts if allowed to scan outgoing mail. If you have an app that isn't Windows Security, it's more likely to cause issues.

Thanks for this suggestion :) I have AVG Antivirus installed. I didn't suspect this to be the cause because I have 2 email accounts set-up on Thunderbird, an @hotmail.com one as well as an @gmail.com one. I have never had an issue sending out emails from the gmail one.

It's generally recommended to disable AV scanning of the profile folder and also of secure connections. With AVG/Avast, this means disabling the Email or Mail Shield.

content:
Hello there

Sending files that are too large appears to be impossible.

you can set up your server if disabling your security didn't help.

The server time out settings can be changed to give your request a longer time to download your email files than normal.

Add ons can also be a part of the cause.


Greetings Firefox volunteer.
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
Hello there

To do this, you bypass the specified time for the server download that is specified by default in your software and then you essentially bypass the error you are experiencing.

It’s called setting the time out for the server.


Greetings Firefox volunteer
creator: googlethunderbird

content:
Anzitutto: Il sito support.mozilla.org è solo un'area di discussione a disposizione degli utenti Mozilla; Non è un servizio di supporto tecnico, che del resto sarebbe insostenibile per un programma gratuito.

Per gli account POP ci sono discrete possibilità che la posta sia recuperabile (le configurazioni e gli account no). Fai subito un backup del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo

Poi prenditi un po' di pazienza e fai l’elenco di tutti i file e le cartelle contenute nel profilo all'interno di una cartella chiamata semplicemente mail e riporta tutto in questa discussione. Se ci sono dati privati oscurali il necessario.

Per farti una idea, il percorso di recupero dati che voglio suggerirti è grosso modo questo -> https://radiofaro.neocities.org/kb/index/002 ma prima bisogna vedere cosa effettivamente c'è nel profilo.

content:
info10373 said
Hello, I'm trying to archive some of my messages outside my computer on a medium that I want to keep so that I can return to them easily. Is there a simple procedure suitable for computer ignoramuses like me :-) ?

The simplest way is to select the messages, then Ctrl+S to save them as eml files to an external folder. An eml file can be opened in TB and most other mail apps, and can also be imported back to TB by drag and drop to Local Folders.

There is an add-on, ImportExportTools NG, with additional options.
creator: sfhowes

content: I don't know your problem specifically, but I suggest first verifying that Thunderbird is connected to a dictionary. click 'new message' and in text area, right click and select 'languages' to check. If not, this link may assist: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1389757
creator: davidsk

content: You might try the 'mailmerge' addon, and experiment with its options. My other suggestion is to consider using a mailing service, such as Mailchimp, as it has a free service that may fill your needs.
creator: davidsk

content:
See https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems

Start with launching TB in safe/troubleshoot mode, and then run Windows in safe mode. These two steps will test for the most likely causes of poor performance.
creator: sfhowes

content: Who is the mail provider? Some, like gmail and outlook.com, copy sent messages automatically to a folder, so to avoid the error, some settings in TB have to be adjusted.
creator: sfhowes

content:
The mail provider is ionos and we use SMTP and IMAP to connect to their email servers.

i feel as if I probably just need to find the local copies of the messages and then copy them to a specific new location or perhaps use an import command of some kind.. just not sure what to do to get them to show in the sent folder
creator: info10375

content: I have never had a problem just highlighting the message in local folder, rightclick and select move to the desired sent folder.
creator: davidsk

content: The destination folder for sent messages might be named Sent, Sent Mail or Sent Items, depending on the provider, so that must be set in Account Settings, Copies & Folders, and the correct folder must be subscribed. Right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe, to see the available folders.
creator: sfhowes

content:
It looks like your Inbox is acting like a Drafts folder. Use this add-on to correct it:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/folderflags/
creator: sfhowes

content: A SPAM or Bulk folder is created by the mail provider. Right-click the account in the Folder Pane, Subscribe, and uncheck (unsubscribe) the unwanted folders.
creator: sfhowes

content: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, opens the profile in File Explorer. Close TB and copy this folder to a backup, or better, go up 2 levels and backup the Profiles folder. If you use an external app to backup, make sure TB is closed when the app operates.
creator: sfhowes

I'll probably take your advice and just keep on googling, though v115 has wasted so much of my time that I'm about to just switch to f*%$ing Outlook.  :-(

content: Try this: close TB, delete global-messages-db.sqlite from the profile folder (as you did when re-indexing), then restart TB and select Tools/Activity Manager to watch the re-indexing progress (see picture). It can take a few minutes even for only a few thousand messages. Confirm that the process completes without errors. Also, in case you have several profiles, make sure you deleted the sqlite file from the current profile.
creator: sfhowes
